greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest k such that n+1 = a prime, n+2 = 2 * a prime, ..., n+k is k times a prime, a(n) = 0 if n+1 is not a prime.
comment: First 4 occurs at n=12720, first 5 occurs at n=19440. See A074200.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..21000
mathematica: Table[If[CompositeQ[n + 1], 0, k = 1; While[Times @@ Boole@ Map[PrimeQ, MapIndexed[#1/First@ #2 &, (n + Range@ k)]] == 1, k++]; k - 1], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 01 2016 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A278500 n) (let loop ((k 1)) (let ((h (/ (+ n k) k))) (if (or (not (integer? h)) (zero? (A010051 h))) (- k 1) (loop (+ 1 k))))))
xref: Cf. A072668 (positions of zeros), A006093 (nonzeros), A089965 (positions of terms >= 2), A278583 (of terms >= 3), A278585 (of terms >= 4).
Cf. A074200 (position of the first term >= n).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 30 2016
